root: ^Mr. Anderson. I present to you this letter, provided to me by Mr. Jenkins' elder son, Arthur.
^I... I... I've never seen that before.
^Are you sure, Mr. Anderson? You don't recognize the handwriting?
^I told you, I don't know where that came from!
^That's odd, because it bears your initials at the bottom. 'P.A.' Could that stand for Phillip Anderson?
^That could be anyone's initials! They are not exclusive to me.
^You're correct, Mr. Anderson. But what's peculiar is that the handwriting on this letter matches the documents you've written for Mr. Jenkins, the ones I've inspected.
^This is an outrage! A disgraceful attempt to smear my reputation! How does this letter even link me to the crime? Do you think I am that foolish to leave such a blatant trace?
^This letter suggests an unusual relationship between you, Mr. Anderson, and Mrs. Jenkins, the wife of our deceased merchant.
^This is slander! I would never betray Mr. Jenkins in such a manner. You have no proof!
^Mr. Jenkins' elder son, Arthur, has shared his suspicion of a possible affair between you and Mrs. Jenkins. And as a detective, I can't ignore such a claim.
^It's preposterous! Arthur has always been an overly suspicious fool!
^Is there anyone here who can provide any evidence about the alleged relationship between Mr. Anderson and Mrs. Jenkins?

^I don't usually pry into other people's business, but I have to say, there have been times when their relationship seemed...unusual. They were often seen together, even when my father was not present.
^I'm sorry, Mr. Anderson, but it's true. I've once walked in on you and Mrs. Jenkins...kissing. I didn't mean to spy, it just...happened.
^This...this is a conspiracy against me! I demand justice!
^This is ludicrous! You're stretching assumptions too far, detective. An affair, even if it were true, doesn't prove Phillip has any murderous intentions.

^Mrs. Jenkins, I respect your defense, but consider this: if the merchant were out of the picture, wouldn't Mr. Anderson gain significant control over the merchant's wealth? It's not unheard of, a man seducing a rich man's wife for financial gain...
^This is a preposterous accusation! I was not even near the merchant last night! I have witnesses!
^Indeed, Mr. Anderson. Witnesses. I am aware of your supposed alibi, but there's a part of it that could potentially be false.

choice: ^And who would that be? My witness is impeccable!

c-0: ^I was led to believe that Jonathan was vouching for your whereabouts at the time of the murder, but...
^It seems we must rely on other evidences then.
c-1: ^Mr. Anderson, you claim to have a solid alibi.
^However, what if I were to tell you that Captain Reynolds himself could be providing a false witness?
^I never saw Captain Reynolds after I left the bridge.
^I have no other business with him.
^Give me a minute to think again.
c-2: ^It's Mrs. Jenkins. Her testament might be compromised.
^If we consider the fact that you were in an affair with Mrs. Jenkins, it becomes plausible that she could've assisted you in the crime.
^You see, Mr. Anderson, it's all about relationships, and power dynamics...
^Where's your proof that I murdered the merchant?
^Mr. Anderson, you say you were busy with business in the merchant's room.
^But Miss Jenkins, the maid, attests that she never saw you there when she brought in the merchant's dinner.
^So, the maid now determines where I was and wasn't?
^Perhaps she was too busy with her tasks to notice me.
^Both you and Mrs. Jenkins testified that you were in Mr. Jenkins' room, busy with some dealings, but you're nowhere to be seen there.
^Can you explain this discrepancy, Mr. Anderson?
^I don't have to explain anything to you!
^Then help me untwist them, Mr. Anderson.
^Where were you, really, when the merchant was having his dinner?
^I was doing what I was hired for - ensuring Mr. Jenkins' business affairs were in order!
^Mr. Anderson, I believe there's one final contradiction that we've yet to address.

presentKnot: ^This is the item I want to present.
wrongKnot: ^Detective, I don't think that item proves your point in any way!
^Apologies Captain, let me try that again
